channel.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
channel.description:
Infinity Ward have shown off the Prestige Edition of Modern Warfare 2 and it looks mighty tasty.
[url]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FMSS12iY1X0[/url]
[spoiler]I'm a sucker for art books and the night vision goggles pretty much have me sold on this! Plus on top of that I can give a free copy of CoD1 for PC to my gf.[/spoiler]

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: Kaze
item.description:
Because a set of proper, quality night vision goggles, binocular style, are nowhere near the sub-$100 range. You can’t even pick up a decent monocular NVG for $100. Maybe $150-$200, but not $100.

A real pair of binocular night vision goggles is going to run you at the very least $200, and that’s pushing the low end of the spectrum. If you want a pair of uber-leet Sam Fisher special ops stealth mode ultra wall hax binocular goggles like these generic goggles IW is packing with the game are advertised as, you’re going to spend at least $500-$600 or more.

Have you ever worn a pair of $100 night vision goggles? They wash out your vision and you go effectively blind. You can see better with your eye’s natural night vision after it adjusts to the lower sensitivity of light than you can with a low quality NVG.

This is a pair of sub-$100 NVGs. Look pretty legit huh?

https://www.amazon.com/EyeClops-Vision-Infrared-Stealth-Goggles/dp/B00153F5QA/ref=pd_bxgy_sg_text_b

Yeah, they’re the same ones ThinkGeek “made”, from that link Jambo posted. They’re a kids toy.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: raw_bean
item.description:
I’m usually in favour of cynicism and healthy scepticism, but I’m not sure what’s so unbelievable about affordable night-vision. After all infra-red light, digital cameras and small video screens are commonplace technology these days (for one thing you can find them all in fairly basic mobile phones), not Star Trek levels of futuristic dreaming.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Kaze:

If you recall, Jambo made the remark you can get a decent pair of night vision goggles for under $100, which, as you should probably know, is a load of shit. And that’s if you get them from a reputable company. THAT is why there is “such a fuss”. I couldn’t give a shit less if you do buy it, just puts more money into flow.

That was never actually proven, you just ranted that it couldn’t be true and expected everyone to agree with you. I’ll get the collector’s edition if it’s not too highly priced, or grab a pair of NV goggles from ThinkGeek to see if they really work. It’s only like $90 after all.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
That actually happened here in Aus not long ago, a guy wanted to test how fast his car would go, without being pulled over by the highway patrol.

So he got some NVG’s and apparently got to about 250KM/h before he went past a speed camera, that clocked him.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: Crunchy
item.description:
Kaze:

Half the reason you drive with your lights on at night is for other cars to see you, bub.

Lol. I’ve never done it, but I know someone that has. I’ve used his night vision and it is awesome. Also he has to do it for his job…but I won’t get into specifics.

As for myself, I’m a leet driver. I’ve never caused an accident and have only had one ticket (although I speed all the time).

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: Kaze
item.description:
JohnKiller118:

Looks cool, not that I plan on getting CoD6:MW2.

Thanks for informing us of that, especially with the bold, italics, and underline.

Collision:

Fine, don’t buy the special edition, and you wont have to worry about having spent money on something that doesn’t work.

But in todays modern marketing laws, you can’t at all say they work and have them not actually work.

But like I said, don’t buy them Kaze and you wont have a problem, some of us though like to collect these kinds of special edition memorabilia and thats purely up to us.

Tbh man, I don’t know why your kicking up such a fuss over what we choose to buy.

There is no fuss, and yes, the marketing does work because people are stupid enough to fall for it. I’m simply pointing out how much of an obvious money sink it is and how it serves no purpose…aesthetically or functionally.

If you recall, Jambo made the remark you can get a decent pair of night vision goggles for under $100, which, as you should probably know, is a load of shit. And that’s if you get them from a reputable company. THAT is why there is “such a fuss”. I couldn’t give a shit less if you do buy it, just puts more money into flow.

Read full topic

item.title: Modern Warfare 2 Prestige Edition unboxing
item.dc:creator: Collision
item.description:
Kaze:

Seriously, this is just going to appeal to those 13-15 year olds who think they’re some sort of special ops trained supersoldier and the 20-somethings who are still too childish in the mind to realize what a waste of money it is.

It’s like the exact same demographic the Halo 3 Limited Edition was aimed at. Delirious faggots who want to be the next Master Chief. Seriously, are you going to do more than glance at the 10 page “art book”? Are you ever going to actually need to use your night vision goggles which, by the way, give you a still unclear range of vision of about 3 feet?

No, you’re going to be playing the game for the majority of the time, which only costs $50 by itself. However you had to go spend the extra $150 to fulfill your childhood fantasies of being the next Sam Fisher. Congratulations, you are a retard

Fine, don’t buy the special edition, and you wont have to worry about having spent money on something that doesn’t work.

But in todays modern marketing laws, you can’t at all say they work and have them not actually work.

But like I said, don’t buy them Kaze and you wont have a problem, some of us though like to collect these kinds of special edition memorabilia and thats purely up to us.

Tbh man, I don’t know why your kicking up such a fuss over what we choose to buy.

Read full topic

I bought Halo 3 used for thirty bucks, then bought the helmet on eBay for forty. The helmet is way to small to fit over the head of some douche that’s supposed to be seven feet tall.

Not to mention it’s just an unwearable hunk of plastic that doesn’t even look good on display.
